Under that project sewing machines provided and trained women for tailoring and stitching and made them self sufficient. Society has undertaken child education project under that provided free quality education to provided computer education and language courses. Our target groups have been poor and down trodden people of this Nation, irrespective of caste, creed and religion. We believe in Networking and partnership with Government & Non-Government Agencies and Institutions to bring in resources for the development of the marginalized. Ongoing Target Intervention Project (IDU) funded by DSACS in Subzi Mandi, Malka Ganj, Delhi. We were honored by NACO for â€œConsistent support in implementation of National AIDS Control Program in Delhi. LFAT to work for 400 injecting drug users (IDUs) under the TI project. Attention will be attached to women IDUs and sexual partners of IDUs. The TI project targeting IDUs is of special interest to LFAT because of the challenges injecting drug use poses to sustainable human development. LFAT has been implementing TI project for injecting drug users since DEC 2012 Ongoing child development Center project was started in September 2014 to provide support to the children of under privileged community of Gwalior M.P . Our project area is Emilinaka Skinder kamppu. Their basic requirement of education and nutrition is not fulfilled with their meager income. The CDC project motivates the children towards education and Nutritional support. The Project has four major components to bring holistic development in the children physical, spiritual, social and cognitive development. Aim of the Project Child Development Centre is helping the children to come out of the poverty. Aim and Objectives â€¢ To help children to develop socially, physically, mentally and spiritually. â€¢ To help the children to develop life skills so that they can cope with difficult circumstances in their lives. â€¢ To make parents, relatives, and guardians realize their roles and responsibilities for holistic development of their children. â€¢ To make the community aware of child rights and implication in the community as well as society. Social Development Social and emotional development of the children is most necessary as they live in an environment, which keeps them alienated from civil society. They find to develop a kind of gap between them and other societal people. The purpose of the social emotional DEVELOPMENT is the growth of the children in the social sector to makes them confident. The following activities were organized, which will help them to mingle with mainstream society. Physical Development Malnutrition and poor health are the major factors, which badly affect proper growth of the children. This project provides balance and diet nutrition to all the children enrolled in the programme. Health facilities are also provided to the children. Following activities were organized to make the children physically sound. Activities â€¢Studies(all subjects and curriculum) â€¢ Drawing & painting â€¢ School supplies â€¢ Counseling â€¢ Class studies based on subjects Spiritual Development Of The Children Spiritual development is the valuable part of this project. Spiritual programmes are conducted every month and spiritual materials are providing exhausts & carried out in the class room for teachings by child counselors as well as all the staffs of the centre. Spiritual development is must to establish them in society. They are made aware about the rich cultural values of our country. A sense of good behavior and moral principles is developed through this programme. Children are educated about the major festivals, important days as well as important personalities of the world. Following activities were organized under this component: Activities â€¢ Festival Celebration (Christmas) Children during spiritual cultural program at our centre. â€¢ Story Telling â€¢ Skits and dance Conclusion: They are coming to the Centre in two shifts. Children are enjoying t and learning a lot of things. Parents are also satisfied with the progress of the children and also with the kind of facilities provided to them. Regular attendance of the children is very encouraging. It is assumed that children will enjoy the benefits of this programme to make their life meaningful in future.
